gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਬਾਰਿ ਬੋਰੇ ਕਿਤੇ ਅਗਨਿ ਜਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Kite Daar(i) Bore Kite Agad(i) Jdare||
translation: Many were drowned in water and many were bound in fire;

transliteration: Kite Adh(i) Chdere Kite Baandh Phdare||35||203||
translation: Many were sawed into halves and many were bound and their bellies wre torn.35.203.

gurmukhi: ਲਗਿਓ ਦੋਖ ਭੂਪੰ ਬਢਿਯੋ ਕੁਸਟ ਦੇਹੀ ॥
transliteration: Lagio Dokh Bhoopan Badhio Koust Dehee||
translation: The king then suffered from the blemish of Brahmin-killing and his body was inflicted by leprosy.

gurmukhi: ਸਭੇ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਬੋਲੇ ਕਰਿਓ ਰਾਜ ਨੇਹੀ ॥
transliteration: Sabhe Bipra Bole Kario Raaj Nehee||
translation: He called all other Brahmins and treated them with love.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੋ ਕੳੁਨ ਸੋ ਬੈਠਿ ਕੀਜੈ ਬਿਚਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Kaho Kaoun So Baith(i) Keejai Bichaaran||
translation: He asked them to sit and contemplate as to how,

gurmukhi: ਦਹੇ ਦੇਹ ਦੋਖੰ ਮਿਟੇ ਪਾਪ ਭਾਰੰ ॥੩੬॥੨੦੪॥
translation: The suffering of the body and the great sin can be removed.36.204.

gurmukhi: ਬੋਲੇ ਰਾਜ ਦੁਅਾਰੰ ਸਭੈ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਅਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Bole Raaj Duaaran Sabhai Bipra Aae||
translation: All the invited Brahmins came to the royal court.

gurmukhi: ਬਡੇ ਬਿਅਾਸ ਤੇ ਅਾਦਿ ਲੈ ਕੈ ਬੁਲਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Bade Biaas Te Aadh Lai Kai Bulaae||
translation: The eminent like Vyas and other were called.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖੈ ਲਾਗ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਬੋਲੇ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਸਰਬੰ ॥
transliteration: Dekhai Laag Saastran Bole Bipra Saraban||
translation: After scanning the Shastras, all the Brahmins said,

gurmukhi: ਕਰਯੋ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਮੇਧੰ ਬਢਿਓ ਭੂਪ ਗਰਬੰ ॥੩੭॥੨੦੫॥
transliteration: Daryo Bipra Medhan Badhio Bhoop Gadaban||37||205||
translation: “The ego of the king hath increased and because of this conceit, he mashed the Brahmins.37.205.
“Listen, O Supreme monarch, the treasure of learning;

gurmukhi: ਕਰਯੋ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਮੇਧੰ ਸੁ ਜੱਗੰ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਨੰ ॥
transliteration: Daryo Bipra Medhan Su Jaggadg Pramaanan||
translation: “Thou didst mash the Brahmins during the sacrifice;
“All this happened suddenly, no one directed thee for this;

gurmukhi: ਕਰੀ ਜੳੁਨ ਹੋਤੀ ਭੲੀ ਬਾਤ ਤੳੁਨੈ ॥੩੮॥੨੦੬॥
translation: “All this hath been got done by the Providence, such happening had been recorded earlier.”38.206.
